alert.note: Alert for Neosho (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 8:34PM CDT until May 07 at 10:21PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kansas... Neosho River at Oswego affecting Cherokee and Labette Counties. Neosho River near Erie affecting Neosho County. Neosho River near Chanute affecting Allen and Neosho Counties. Neosho River near Parsons affecting Neosho and Labette Counties. For the Neosho River...including Iola, Chanute, Erie, Parsons, Oswego...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neosho River near Erie. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, The road 7 miles northwest of Erie at 190th Road just west of Big Creek becomes flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Friday the stage was 32.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 13.3 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Neosho River Erie 29.0 32.2 Fri 8 pm CDT 24.8 15.3 13.6 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
